DataElement.preferredName: During Collection Hematopoietic Stem Cell Graft Combined Other Anticoagulant Agent Administration Therapies Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The free-text field to describe other anticoagulants that were added to the hematopoietic cell graft during collection.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: During Collection Hematopoietic Stem Cell Graft Combined Other Anticoagulant Agent Administration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: At some point in a given period of time._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place._Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)_Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body._Made or joined or united into one or involving the joint activity of two or more._Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned._A drug that helps prevent blood clots from forming. Also called a blood thinner._The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

ObjectClass.preferredName: During Collection Hematopoietic Stem Cell Graft
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: At some point in a given period of time.:The act of gathering something together.:Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.):Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body.

Concepts.definition: At some point in a given period of time.
The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.

Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)
Tissue or organ transplanted from a donor to a recipient.

Property.preferredDefinition: Made or joined or united into one or involving the joint activity of two or more.:Not otherwise specified.:Agents that prevent blood clotting. Naturally occurring agents in the blood are included only when they are used as drugs.:The act of administration.

Concepts.definition: Made or joined or united into one or involving the joint activity of two or more.
Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
Any agent capable of preventing blood clot formation.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the free text field related to therapy.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Specify; be specific about something; define clearly.

Concepts.definition: Be specific about something; define clearly.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: released as entered during ISO compliance update

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Artificial Neural Network Algorithm for BRIDG Mapping

ReferenceDocuments.name: BRIDG mapping path for CDE:2741589
ReferenceDocuments.description: PerformedSubstanceAdministration > Product [stem cells] > Subject [stem cells] > PerformedProcedure > Product [additive] > MaterialName.name WHERE PerformedSubstanceAdministration > DefinedSubstanceAdministration = "Perform Overall hematopoitic stem cell transplantation" AND Product.typeCode [StemCells] = "stem cells" AND Product.typeCode [additive] = "anticoagulant" AND PerformedProcedure > DefinedProcedure.nameCode = "process hematopoitic stem cell transplantation product"
